In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **Y** serves the following purposes:

- y represents a [light](/wiki/Light_\(monster_class\) "Light (monster class)"):

  - y [yellow light](/wiki/Yellow_light "Yellow light")
  - y [black light](/wiki/Black_light "Black light")

* Y represents an [apelike creature](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature"):

  - Y [monkey](/wiki/Monkey "Monkey")
  - Y [ape](/wiki/Ape "Ape")
  - Y [owlbear](/wiki/Owlbear "Owlbear")
  - Y [yeti](/wiki/Yeti "Yeti")
  - Y [carnivorous ape](/wiki/Carnivorous_ape "Carnivorous ape")
  - Y [sasquatch](/wiki/Sasquatch "Sasquatch")

- It is also used as a [direction](/wiki/Direction "Direction") key if [numpad](/wiki/Numpad "Numpad") movement is off:

  - Press [y]() to move northwest.
  - Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [y]() to move far northwest.

* If numpad movement is on:
  - Pressing [y]() answers yes to questions with "yes/no" prompts. As such, be wary of moving by holding down the key or else pressing it repeatedly: you may risk attacking a powerful [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") monster to your northwest, especially in areas like [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown"). See [paranoid\_hit](/wiki/Paranoid_hit "Paranoid hit") for a way to avoid this.

## Historical uses

In PDP-11 Hack, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), yeti used the Y glyph as normal; this was also the case from [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"). The apelike creature [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") was introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), and its members - the ape and carnivorous ape - instead used A as their glyph. In [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), the apelike creatures were moved to Y with the yeti to make room for [angelic beings](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being"), and the owlbear was changed from a [giant humanoid](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid"), H, to an apelike creature.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

While [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") does not introduce any new monsters using y or Y as their glyph, the z [zruty](/wiki/Zruty "Zruty") is moved to the apelike creature monster class and has its glyph changed to Y.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Y

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter Y serves the following purposes:

  • y represents a light:
    • y yellow light
    • y black light
  • Y represents an apelike creature:
    • Y monkey
    • Y ape
    • Y owlbear
    • Y yeti
    • Y carnivorous ape
    • Y sasquatch
  • It is also used as a direction key if numpad movement is off:
    • Press y to move northwest.
    • Press shift + y to move far northwest.
  • If numpad movement is on:
    • Pressing y answers yes to questions with "yes/no" prompts. As such, be wary of moving by holding down the key or else pressing it repeatedly: you may risk attacking a powerful peaceful monster to your northwest, especially in areas like Minetown. See paranoid_hit for a way to avoid this.

Historical uses

In PDP-11 Hack, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, yeti used the Y glyph as normal; this was also the case from Hack 1.0 to NetHack 3.0.10. The apelike creature monster class was introduced in NetHack 3.0.0, and its members - the ape and carnivorous ape - instead used A as their glyph. In NetHack 3.1.0, the apelike creatures were moved to Y with the yeti to make room for angelic beings, and the owlbear was changed from a giant humanoid, H, to an apelike creature.

Variants

SLASH'EM

While SLASH'EM does not introduce any new monsters using y or Y as their glyph, the z zruty is moved to the apelike creature monster class and has its glyph changed to Y.
